About this job

Job type: Full-time

Role: Mobile Developer

Job description

JBS has an opening for a well-rounded mobile developer with Xamarin experience.
Required

  • 3+ years working with iOS and Android native mobile development
  • 1+ years working with Xamarin
  • Strong knowledge of javascript  
  • Experience with react and react native
  • Experience working with CSS and PSD/Sketch UI designs
  • Published apps in App Store and/or Google Play Store
  • Experience with devOps (automated deployments and continuous integration)

  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Ability to accurately estimate work
  • Commitment to provide quality completed deliverables with well-factored, maintainable code

Nice To Have

  • Experience in e-commerce development
  • Experience building and designing REST-based web services using JSON
  • Experience with containerization

Apply now

items.title: Solution Architect - Web Crawling at Scrapinghub
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=10, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Big Data
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

pythonweb-scrapingscrapyarchitectureweb-crawler

Job description

Scrapinghub is looking for a motivated Solution Architect to further accelerate the rapid growth Scrapinghub has seen in the last 3+ years.

As a Solution Architect, you will be in charge of the requirement analysis phase of our Professional Services projects. You will gather the customer requirements, analyze and provide technical solutions to our customers and our internal teams for development and delivery. You will be pivotal in translating customer and technical project requirements across various internal and external teams.   

Job Responsibilities:

    • Meet with customers for requirement collection and provide technical consultation and advice.
    • Deconstruct raw business / customer  requirements and identifying the actual business problems the customer is trying to solve.
    • Translate customer requirements into a viable business solution, execute the necessary; conduct deep technical investigation, propose the best approach and solution inclusive of effort, cost estimates, and occasionally project timelines which fit the customer’s business goals and expectations.
    • Build Proof of Concepts, to showcase technical expertise in data acquisition projects, assess feasibility, refine scope, and  achieve project collaboration and engagement
    • Mentor developers to build a strong team of Solution Architects.
    • Ensure you are up-to-date on Scrapinghub products and service offerings which will enable you to provide an architectural solution that includes the latest capabilities and provide value to our customers
    • Create, write and present customer proposals and ensure it completely captures the technical requirements for the solution proposed
    • Take ownership of learning upcoming product and service capabilities by requesting training sessions from the concerned team.
    • Work with subject matter experts to provide better solutions.

About you:

    • You have solid knowledge and understanding of aspects of web crawling using Python & Scrapy.
    • You have strong client and customer facing experience - minimum of 3 years experience in a similar position within a technical environment
    • You have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and are comfortable in document writing, both technical and non technical
    • You possess excellent presentation skills and experience in articulating technical and business solutions to both technical and non technical audiences.
    • You have the ability to articulate and convey technical solutions effectively and clearly to internal teams and stakeholders.
    • You have the zeal to understand customer business requirements really well by asking the right questions.
    • You have the confidence to assert and justify the technical feasibility of a requirement, to make decisions, negotiate scope, and assess risk.
    • You have solid experience of mentoring teams preferably software developers.
    • You demonstrate proven knowledge and experience of estimation, planning, and project management.
    • You are well organized, self-motivated, and communicative -- an essential skill in a remote team.

Bonus points for:

    • You have experience in web crawling in any other tools.
    • A proven track record of working with a remote team
    • Knowledge of and interest in web crawling, data mining and information retrieval
Apply now

About Scrapinghub

Founded in 2010, Scrapinghub is a fast growing and diverse technology business turning web content into useful data with a cloud-based web crawling platform, off-the-shelf datasets, and turn-key web scraping services.

We’re a globally distributed team of 120 Shubbers working from over 30 countries who are passionate about scraping, web crawling, and data science.

As a new Shubber, you will:

Become part of a self-motivated, progressive, multi-cultural team.

Autonomy to make the role your own, supported by great people

Join a team with huge opportunity to make a difference

Have the freedom to work from wherever you want.

Have the opportunity to go to conferences and meet with the team from across the globe.

Get the chance to work with cutting-edge open source technologies and tools.

Benefits

  • Flexible working hours
  • Remote working
  • Paid time off
  • Paid open source work
  • Global team meet ups

items.title: Oasis Digital Solutions Inc.: Node.js developer - enterprise integration - contractor
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=29, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=11}
items.content:
Node.js developer - enterprise integration - contractor

Posted Jun 18

Oasis Digital Solutions Inc.
Headquarters: St. Louis, MO
https://oasisdigital.com/
View all Oasis Digital Solutions Inc. jobs →

Oasis Digital is looking for Node developers for a complex project involving enterprise integration of multiple pre-existing systems using microservices. Full staff experience is appreciated, but most of the problems to be solved are in backend development. You will be working on a project an important Oasis Digital customer, working closely with both Oasis Digital and customer developers.

Key qualifications

  • 2+ years of Node experience

  • 3+ years of JavaScript experience

  • Comfortable with the asynchronous nature of JavaScript and Node

  • Able to explain and assist other developers with Node development

  • Eager to both collaborate extensively and produce independently

  • BS degree in a technical field strongly preferred

  • Live and work in the USA - while the work is remote, for this project it must be remote only within the USA.

  • Fluently communicate in English, but also comfortable interacting with developers around the world

  • Experience with integrating disparate systems

  • Have your own workspace

  • Comfortable with online meetings using video chat and screen sharing

Essentials of the job

  • Contractor, working remotely from your own location

  • Likely 6+ months

  • 35+ hours per week

  • Hourly, contractor pay - occasionally >40 hours is possible

  • 95% remote

  • Visit us in St. Louis, once or twice a year

  • Daily meetings working out the details of complex integrations - so you must be available during the workday.

  • You can flexibly schedule your own working days and times - though this is considerably constrained by the need to meet with others.

 

Technology stack

  • Node

  • JavaScript

  • Microservices

  • Docker

  • Angular

Our hiring process

  1. We review your resume and answers to a few questions

  2. ~15 minute initial video chat discussion

  3. ~45 minute deeper technical discussion and interview

  4. ~60 minute remote shared coding session, where we see you in action and you get to know us a bit more

  5. final "HR style" interview

  6. background check and start date

Apply for this position

Please apply at the following page: https://oasisdigital.applytojob.com/apply/00TJBw6WR4/Nodejs-Developer-Enterprise-Integration-Remotecontract

items.title: Solutions Architect - NLP and Machine Learning at Critical Mix (Perrysburg, OH)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=36, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=25}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Manager
Industry: Integrated Marketing Solutions
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

reactjsgopythonwatson-conversationphp

Job description

   Critical Mix is looking for a Solutions Architect to work with our teams across the United States and is passionate on simplifying the complex with digital innovation.  Success in this position will require some unique knowledge in the areas of natural language processing services such as Watson and Lex as well as expertise in machine learning technologies. Of course, none of this really functions without an exceptional and intuitive BOT interface for the end user.

Responsibilities:

  • Take technical lead on the team in the ML/NLP domain and keep up with latest industry solutions.
  • Design, develop, validate and deploy proposed ML/NLP solutions both internal and client facing.
  • Innovate and build new features for our products including chatbots and virtual assistants.
  • Coaching and mentoring a team of diverse and talented software engineers.
  • Interfacing with senior management and stakeholders to define requirements and take the lead on operational and technical projects in a fast-paced environment.

Requirements

  • Advanced degree Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related area 
  • 3+ Years of experience building software products as an Architect
  • 1+ years ML/NLP domain experience.
  • Experience with Python or Go programming languages
  • Knowledge of JavaScript frameworks like ReactJS, React Native, AngularJS
  • Experience with Microservices and Resftul API’s
  • Familiarity with a major machine learning/deep learning frameworks a plus (Keras, Tensorflow, Torch, Spark-ML)
Apply now
Ask a question

About Critical Mix

Critical Mix provides easy access to highly-targeted global survey respondents, survey programming and data visualization services for market research and consulting firms. Driven by a passion for simplifying data collection, the team at Critical Mix is personally invested in giving clients the ultimate customer service experience.

Benefits

  • Health benefits
  • Flexible schedule
  • Great work/life integration
  • Empowerment
  • Unlimited vacation policy
  • Competitive compensation
  • Remote location
  • Gym memberships

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Full Stack Developer

Technologies

phpreactjsjavascriptsql

Job description

We are seeking the services of a full time, highly skilled and talented PHP developer to join our rapidly growing team at M3 Solutions (http://www.m3solutions.net.au), an Australian software development company that has been operating for 15 years. M3 Solutions is a small team centrally located near the train line in North Sydney where you can make a real difference and work on a variety of projects.

We are looking to hire someone locally in Sydney however we may consider sponsoring you to work in Australia if we do not find a suitable local candidate. If we are planning to sponsor you then you will need to work remotely from your current location before being sponsored to Australia.

You will have the opportunity to learn new technologies in a highly collaborative and autonomous environment. You will work with a diverse range of senior stakeholders in an exciting environment with real work-life balance. Progress your career to the next level with a focus on quality code and be part of a great team.

TO BE THE BEST FIT FOR THIS JOB, YOU MUST BE/HAVE:

  • Proven experience working as a PHP developer
  • Preference for experience also with Java
  • Solid experience with large transactional systems
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL
  • Practical knowledge of Git
  • Comfortable with UNIX/LINUX
  • Advanced skills in HTML, CSS, JavaScript (ideally React)
  • Experience in Angular 4 framework would be well regarded
  • Experience working in agile environment – scrum / Atlassian products
  • Proven experience delivering mission critical projects
  • Flawless communication skills are essential

Salary is negotiable depending on experience.

TO APPLY, please go to this link - http://time-doctor.breezy.hr/p/57bd5704e6bd-php-developer-for-m3-solutions-local

ABOUT THE COMPANY:

M3 Solutions is a software development company that provides automated workflow systems for big multinationals and smaller organisations in Australia. Our solutions have provided efficiency and cost saving technologies for sales, marketing, finance, management reporting and accounting systems. We differentiate ourselves in building custom solutions to fit the customers existing processes.

Apply now

items.title: SEEKING FREELANCER – REMOTE Email: llevitt@iotini.com IoTini is a technology startup working on industrial sensor systems. We offer a complete solution where ...
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=10, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
SEEKING FREELANCER – REMOTE

Email: llevitt@iotini.com

IoTini is a technology startup working on industrial sensor systems. We offer a complete solution where you choose the type of sensors you need, the data you want to visualize and we take care of the rest.

We are looking for a software engineer with experience in API design, usage and implementation of new networking protocols and basic Linux sysadmin chops. Our systems run mostly on top of Ruby with some Erlang and Javascript on the sides, and on your day to day you will be working with our firmware team to add support for new features on the server side, standarizing communication for different protocols (IP and LoRa) and finding ways to efficiently share, process and visualize data between all of our services.

Requirements:* 4+ years of professional experience working with Ruby.* Basic knowledge of either Erlang or Javascript (client and server side).* Experience in architecture and design of non-monolithic systems.* Decent understanding of different types of datastores and their their pros/cons (we use Postgres, MongoDB and Mnesia).* You can setup, secure and maintain Linux servers and cloud instances.

Bonus:* Hardware/electrical engineering background.* Previous experience working on a fully remote team.* Open source contributions, having an interesting GitHub profile or public personal projects.

items.title: Contract Remote Microservice Security Architect (located in the US) at Twin Technologies
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=1, c=0, mobile=3, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=43, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: DevOps, System Administrator
Industry: Consulting, Design, Digital Agency
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

javasecurityjenkinsdevopsdockersysadmin

Job description

Company Description

We dream, create, and deliver digital solutions that transform what’s possible for enterprises, government institutions and organizations and partner with our clients through every stage of digital transformation: from strategy, to activation, to delivery to decrease risk and increase speed-to-market.

We are Remotely Awesome! We understand that quality of life directly impacts quality of work, and we know that talent is all over the place. Our team is not limited by geography, and seeks top talent where it exists. Our remote work model encourages independent thinking, requires professional discipline, and contributes to a high quality work/life balance.

What’s does this mean for you? Many of our team members have the flexibility to work from anywhere in the United States, and is provided the tools and infrastructure to successfully collaborate across the globe. We will continue to grow and evolve with the market and provide an environment where creativity, leadership, mentoring, planning, and resources are in place to achieve our shared goals.

Job Description

The Security Architect will serve as part of a development team supporting both established projects and creating from the ground up. The ideal candidate is an experienced leader and team player with a background in security and a passion for delivering well through DevOps best practices.  They are passionate about technology and committed to lifelong learning, possessing the ability to apply their technical knowledge, skills and experience to solve complex/real-world problems.

Technologies and Disciplines:

We use several different technologies in our development stack across multiple clients and projects. We continuously evaluate new technologies to make sure we are fully aware and always using the right tool for the job. Examples of the technologies we currently use include:

  • Java, JPA, Dropwizard, JBoss, Javascript
  • Docker, Kubernetes, Linkerd, Consul
  • SQL Server, Oracle
  • Jenkins, Maven, Stash, Git
  • AWS EC2, Lambda, S3

Responsibilities:

  • Solving complex problems with elegant and maintainable solutions
  • Designing, implementing, and evaluating microservice architecture implementations to improve delivery and support new features
  • Delivering back-end and tooling solutions using modern Java frameworks
  • Developing and bringing security processes in line with current best practices
  • Integrating existing legacy Java enterprise system with microservice/mesh architecture based APIs
  • Working with the team to continuously improve security across all areas of the software project
  • Participating on an agile / scrum software delivery team

Qualifications

  • A strong foundation in computer security and authz & authn best practices
  • 5-10+ years software engineering experience
  • 1-2+ years experience integrating with Identity and Access Management frameworks, or security policy and enforcement toolsets.
  • Secured APIs and services within SOA or microservice architectures
  • Experience with Kubernetes resource APIs and related CLI tools
  • Experience with running and defining Docker containers
  • Comfortable using and configuring software on Linux based operating systems
  • Familiar with service mesh proxies like Istio/Envoy or Linkerd
  • Understands best practices for JWT algorithm choice and token claim assertions
  • Capable of integrating security related components into CI/CD automation pipelines using tools like Spinnaker or Jenkins
  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • Applicants MUST be US Citizens, due to the nature of the work
  • Applicants MUST live in the US, with a remote home office
  • This is a contract position to start

Additional Information

Twin Technologies offers a competitive and comprehensive employee compensation and benefits package that includes medical, dental and vision insurance, LTD, STD, life insurance, 401k program with company match, and an unlimited PTO plan

Twin Technologies is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Apply now

About Twin Technologies

At Twin Technologies, Inc. we dream, create, and deliver digital solutions that transform what’s possible for enterprises, government institutions and organizations. We partner with our clients through every stage of digital transformation: from strategy- to activation - to delivery, while we decrease risk and increase speed-to-market.

Twin has been a “Remotely Awesome” company for the past 14+ years and continues to master best practices and strategies around collaboration, communication, and tools, across our high-performing distributed teams.

What’s does this mean for you?  We will continue to grow and evolve with the market to provide an environment where creativity, leadership, mentoring, and some of the best resources are in place to achieve high standards in the consulting and digital space

You will work on a variety of projects that integrate digital designs into products, services and environments. 

Twin Technologies offers a competitive and comprehensive employee compensation and benefits package, which includes medical, dental, and vision insurance, LTD, STD, life insurance, a 401k plan with company match, and an unlimited PTO plan.

Twin Technologies is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Benefits

  • annual stipend for hardware
  • progressive 401k matching plan
  • generous health and dental coverage
  • growth, support, and mentorship
  • company hosted and sponsored events
  • training and conferences stipend
  • telecommuting reimbursement program
  • unlimited PTO
  • work remote from home office
  • work with amazing people

items.title: Security Architect
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=8, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

LOCATION:
Belgium
(Partial remote)

Anywhere in
Belgium


EXPERIENCE: expert

COMPANY: Sogeti Belgium; 50-75 employees; 50-75% remote;

A Security Architect designs, builds and oversees the implementation of network and computer security for an organization.

As a senior-level employee, you’ll be responsible for creating complex security structures – and ensuring they work.

Since this is a “big-picture” job, you may be required to:

Acquire a complete understanding of a company’s technology and information systems
Plan, research and design robust security architectures for any IT project
Perform vulnerability testing, risk analyses and security assessments
Research security standards, security systems and authentication protocols
Test final security structures to ensure they behave as expected
Provide technical supervision for (and guidance to) a security team
Define, implement and maintain corporate security policies and procedures
Respond immediately to security-related incidents and provide a thorough post-event analysis
Update and upgrade security systems as needed

- You have a Master degree or equal by relevant experience
- 10+ years of relevant experience
- Knowledge of GDPR requirements
- Affinity with SAP & Microsoft Solutions
- Risk assessment procedures, policy formation, role-based authorization methodologies, authentication technologies and security attack pathologies
- Windows, UNIX and Linux operating systems
- Practices and methods of IT strategy, enterprise architecture and security architecture
- Network security architecture development and definition
- Knowledge of third party auditing and cloud risk assessment methodologies
- You’re a strategic problem-solver and have good communication skills
- You speak English and French or Dutch

What's in it for you?

Sogeti is the perfect place to bring your passion for IT into play and learn new skills.

You will be given the opportunity to develop your career through working on interesting projects, our internal training & development program, attend training courses to broaden your knowledge and obtain certifications. That’s how we boost your personal career and encourage life-long learning in your area of expertise!

Your evolution will be monitored closely by your operations manager, a counselor and your own HR business partner.

Sogeti is also known for lot of fun, an open minded company environment and where the informal communication culture are part of its DNA. You can also count on an attractive salary package and fringe benefits (e.g. company car, personal flex plan,…).

items.title: Cybersecurity Senior Solutions Architect - Remote
items.content:
Cybersecurity Senior Solutions Architect - Remote - Jobmote

Cybersecurity Senior Solutions Architect - Remote

Slait Consulting

SLAIT Consulting is currently seeking a Cybersecurity Senior Solutions Architect for our client in Dallas, TX. This is a remote position with some travel required. SUMMARY: The Cyber Security Solutions Architect is responsible for working with both BDS Business Development & account/pursuit sales leadership to define security specific solution strategy. JOB DUTIES /RESPONSIBILITIES: * Responsible for leading the development of technical solutions in the area of cyber security services and offerings. * Ensure the soundness of an integrated security solution and proper BDS Delivery assurance signoff of any/all proposals. * Primary point contact responsible to ensure governance processes (Ex - Rainbow & BDS Governance) are followed and managed pro-actively through the lifecycle of the pursuit/engagement. * Engages with the client, identifies cyber security needs/requirements, engages with SMEs and bid team to work on cyber security proposal and collect HL designs, and validates security solution to be proposed. * Works with engineers and SMEs in the development of the technical solution or offering, in translating the business needs into technical requirements, and is a key contributor in the value proposition. * Supports Bid & Proposal solution development including technical design and development of complex proposals for Cyber Security solutions (managed services, System Integration and Consulting). * Run workshops and conduct security assessments to help the client understand their security and privacy issues, risks, exposure and vulnerabilities including architecting secure solutions to address specific security and privacy requirements. * Create high quality documentation such as Presentations, Risk Assessments, Reports and completing metrics and spreadsheets * Develop and deliver quality client presentations (both virtually and in person) * Evaluates and recommends future technologies and methodologies that will enhance our cyber security services and offerings. QUALIFICATIONS: * Minimum 5 years of Solution Architect experience. * Full lifecycle project experience as Security Consultant including design and implementation. * Client facing experience at a range of levels. * Several years of experience in IT security, compliance, and risk management including privacy and controls. * Implementation experience with enterprise security packages identity management and federation systems. * Familiarity with industry compliance and security standards including PCI DSS, ISO 27001, HIPAA, and NIST experience advising customers on architectures meeting industry standards such as SAS70, SOC1, and FISMA. * Preferred Certifications: QSA, CISSP, CISA, CISM, CRISC Why SLAIT? We have been growing since 1990 with offices in Virginia and Raleigh, NC. For over twenty-eight years, we have delivered customized, creative IT solutions for customers in the commercial, and state and local government sectors. * Staff Augmentation * Managed Services * Security Solutions * IT Consulting Thank you for your consideration, please submit your resume today! Visit us at * * Must be able to work for any employer in the United States. No Visa sponsorship.* * SLAIT Consulting is an Equal Opportunity Employer - provided by Dice

IT security

items.content:
Cybersecurity Senior Solutions Architect - Remote - Jobmote

Cybersecurity Senior Solutions Architect - Remote

Slait Consulting

SLAIT Consulting is currently seeking a Cybersecurity Senior Solutions Architect for our client in Dallas, TX. This is a remote position with some travel required. SUMMARY: The Cyber Security Solutions Architect is responsible for working with both BDS Business Development & account/pursuit sales leadership to define security specific solution strategy. JOB DUTIES /RESPONSIBILITIES: * Responsible for leading the development of technical solutions in the area of cyber security services and offerings. * Ensure the soundness of an integrated security solution and proper BDS Delivery assurance signoff of any/all proposals. * Primary point contact responsible to ensure governance processes (Ex - Rainbow & BDS Governance) are followed and managed pro-actively through the lifecycle of the pursuit/engagement. * Engages with the client, identifies cyber security needs/requirements, engages with SMEs and bid team to work on cyber security proposal and collect HL designs, and validates security solution to be proposed. * Works with engineers and SMEs in the development of the technical solution or offering, in translating the business needs into technical requirements, and is a key contributor in the value proposition. * Supports Bid & Proposal solution development including technical design and development of complex proposals for Cyber Security solutions (managed services, System Integration and Consulting). * Run workshops and conduct security assessments to help the client understand their security and privacy issues, risks, exposure and vulnerabilities including architecting secure solutions to address specific security and privacy requirements. * Create high quality documentation such as Presentations, Risk Assessments, Reports and completing metrics and spreadsheets * Develop and deliver quality client presentations (both virtually and in person) * Evaluates and recommends future technologies and methodologies that will enhance our cyber security services and offerings. QUALIFICATIONS: * Minimum 5 years of Solution Architect experience. * Full lifecycle project experience as Security Consultant including design and implementation. * Client facing experience at a range of levels. * Several years of experience in IT security, compliance, and risk management including privacy and controls. * Implementation experience with enterprise security packages identity management and federation systems. * Familiarity with industry compliance and security standards including PCI DSS, ISO 27001, HIPAA, and NIST experience advising customers on architectures meeting industry standards such as SAS70, SOC1, and FISMA. * Preferred Certifications: QSA, CISSP, CISA, CISM, CRISC Why SLAIT? We have been growing since 1990 with offices in Virginia and Raleigh, NC. For over twenty-eight years, we have delivered customized, creative IT solutions for customers in the commercial, and state and local government sectors. * Staff Augmentation * Managed Services * Security Solutions * IT Consulting Thank you for your consideration, please submit your resume today! Visit us at * * Must be able to work for any employer in the United States. No Visa sponsorship.* * SLAIT Consulting is an Equal Opportunity Employer - provided by Dice

items.title: Solutions Engineer, Ruby at YouEarnedIt (Austin, TX)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=27, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=12}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: HR Services, SaaS
Company size: 51-200 people

Technologies

javascriptreactjsfluxgraphqlruby-on-rails

Job description

About YouEarnedit:

We are passionate about creating happiness for employees that translates into business results for our customers. We focus on employee engagement and improve all levels of recognition so work experience is elevated. Our goal is for the happiness we help create to spread to everyone in the form of increased engagement, improved morale, and greater profitability!

We are a growing company with a bunch of people who take work seriously, who have high levels of accountability and are tons of fun to work with.  We live what we’re preaching.

Overview of the role:

We’re looking for a seasoned Ruby developer with a passion for technical problem-solving and customer relations to join our growing team. As a Solutions Engineer, you’d leverage your technical expertise and coding skills to solve our customers’ problems. You’d investigate, develop, automate, and communicate to get the job done.  

What you'll do:

  • Spend 50% of your time coding creative solutions to customers’ needs and the other 50% interfacing with customers to support their needs
  • Develop time-saving tools and automated processes to reduce integration setup overhead
  • Work with customers’ technical teams to plan, coordinate, and execute on integrations with 3rd party systems
  • Present YouEarnedIt’s technical capabilities and security features to customers in a pre-sales capacity
  • Work with our Customer Success team to triage, investigate, and resolve customer support issues
  • Influence our product’s direction with your ideas and insight into our customers’ needs

What we want from you:

  • A passion for helping customers find elegant solutions to their complex problems
  • Ability to juggle multiple tasks, reorganize/re-prioritize quickly, without feeling overwhelmed.
  • 3+ years working with a web framework: Ruby on Rails a bonus
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences alike
  • Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills
  • High standards for quality and attention to detail
  • A solid understanding of web fundamentals (HTTP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
  • Proficiency in data mappers such as Mongoid or Active Record
  • Bonus: experience working in a technical, customer-oriented role

To apply - please submit your resume and a cover letter describing why you were inspired to apply with us.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Apply now

Benefits

  • Open Vacation
  • Leave it better days
  • 401k
  • YouEarnedIt as a platform
  • Meaningful Rewards
  • Remote workers
  • Culture of continuous feedback
  • Transparency
  • Wellness
  • Learning & Development

items.title: Demandware / Salesforce Commerce Cloud Solution Architect (Remote)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=4, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=12}
items.content:
Demandware / Salesforce Commerce Cloud Solution Architect (Remote) - Jobmote

Demandware / Salesforce Commerce Cloud Solution Architect (Remote)

ConSol Partners

Demandware / Salesforce Commerce Cloud Solution Architect - (Remote anywhere USA) - up to $200K total package - rapidly growing eCommerce specific agency

T** HE **** COMPANY**

One of the USA's fastest growing digital agencies specific to the eCommerce sector. They work with some of the world's biggest and most well-known retailers and brands. Their global projects allow an individual to work on large scale platforms and implementations alongside some of the leading SFCC professionals in the country.

THE ROLE

  • The role will offer the opportunity to work on a SFCC platform on multiple client projects in a fast paced exciting environment
  • Working as a hands on technical expert working with development teams, client requirements and high level roadmaps
  • Joining a growing team at an early stage offering solid career progression
  • Working on multiple client projects and implementations

THE INDIVIDUAL

  • 2+ years' experience in SFCC / Demandware platform
  • 1-2 years' experience at an architect level (someone with a sold technical background on SFCC stepping up into an Architect role could also be a great fit)
  • Software development background (5+ years) ideally around SFCC / Java or related technologies
  • SFCC / Demandware implementation experience highly desirable
  • Strong experience and understanding of HTML/CSS, Javascript, JQuery, XML, Java
  • Ideally worked in an Agile environment

SALARY: up to$200K total package

LOCATION: Remote (anywhere in the USA)

CONSOL PARTNERS

ConSol Partners provide permanent and contract staffing solutions to FTSE & Fortune 500 companies, global brands and start-ups in the technology domains of Communications , Cloud and Digital . Founded in 2008, ConSol Partners have quickly established themselves as one of the world's leading technology recruitment brands.

With headquarters in the City of London and international offices in Los Angeles' "Silicon Beach" and central Boston. Our niche recruitment offering, coupled with an in-depth expert knowledge of our core markets, enables us to offer a true global recruitment solution and we have made placements in over 55 countries.

  • provided by Dice Demandware / Salesforce Commerce Cloud Solution Architect (Remote) up to $200k package - top eCommerce specific agency

items.title: Cybersecurity senior Solutions Architect - Remote
items.content:
Cybersecurity senior Solutions Architect - Remote - Jobmote

Cybersecurity senior Solutions Architect - Remote

Slait Consulting

SLAIT Consulting is currently seeking a Cybersecurity Senior Solutions Architect for our client in Dallas, TX and Richmond, VA.

This is a remote position with some travel required (10%).

SUMMARY:

The Cyber Security Solutions Architect is responsible for working with both BDS Business Development & account/pursuit sales leadership to define security specific solution strategy.

JOB DUTIES /RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible for leading the development of technical solutions in the area of cyber security services and offerings.

  • Ensure the soundness of an integrated security solution and proper BDS Delivery assurance signoff of any/all proposals.

  • Primary point contact responsible to ensure governance processes (Ex - Rainbow & BDS Governance) are followed and managed pro-actively through the lifecycle of the pursuit/engagement.

  • Engages with the client, identifies cyber security needs/requirements, engages with SMEs and bid team to work on cyber security proposal and collect HL designs, and validates security solution to be proposed.

  • Works with engineers and SMEs in the development of the technical solution or offering, in translating the business needs into technical requirements, and is a key contributor in the value proposition.

  • Supports Bid & Proposal solution development including technical design and development of complex proposals for Cyber Security solutions (managed services, System Integration and Consulting).

  • Run workshops and conduct security assessments to help the client understand their security and privacy issues, risks, exposure and vulnerabilities including architecting secure solutions to address specific security and privacy requirements.

  • Create high quality documentation such as Presentations, Risk Assessments, Reports and completing metrics and spreadsheets

  • Develop and deliver quality client presentations (both virtually and in person)

  • Evaluates and recommends future technologies and methodologies that will enhance our cyber security services and offerings.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Minimum 5 years of Solution Architect experience.

  • Full lifecycle project experience as Security Consultant including design and implementation.

  • Client facing experience at a range of levels.

  • Several years of experience in IT security, compliance, and risk management including privacy and controls.

  • Implementation experience with enterprise security packages identity management and federation systems.

  • Familiarity with industry compliance and security standards including PCI DSS, ISO 27001, HIPAA, and NIST experience advising customers on architectures meeting industry standards such as SAS70, SOC1, and FISMA.

  • Preferred Certifications: QSA, CISSP, CISA, CISM, CRISC

Why SLAIT?

We have been growing since 1990 with offices in Virginia and Raleigh, NC. For over twenty-eight years, we have delivered customized, creative IT solutions for customers in the commercial, and state and local government sectors.

  • Staff Augmentation * Managed Services * Security Solutions * IT Consulting

Thank you for your consideration, please submit your resume today! Visit us at

  • * Must be able to work for any employer in the United States. No Visa sponsorship.* *

SLAIT Consulting is an Equal Opportunity Employer

  • provided by Dice IT security, risk management, compliance

items.title: Microsoft Data/Analytics Solution Architect (Remote)
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

items.content:
Microsoft Data/Analytics Solution Architect (Remote) - Jobmote

Microsoft Data/Analytics Solution Architect (Remote)

BlueGranite

BlueGranite's Solution Architect position is a senior role for individuals with at least twelve years of professional, hands-on experience designing and building business intelligence or data warehouse solutions on the Microsoft platform.

BlueGranite's Solution Architects are expert industry leaders with SQL Server, Power BI, and Azure platforms. They are part of BlueGranite's premier consulting team, leading small-team engagements to design, implement, and support analytics solutions. They demonstrate strong technical leadership skills across components of SQL Server, Power BI and Azure platforms and are able to mentor others with these technologies. Solution Architects may support pre-sales client discussions, project scoping and estimating tasks, and writing statements of work together with our account leadership team.

This full-time, work-from-home consultant position is for individuals who enjoy leading project teams while continuing to work hands-on, building data and analytics solutions using the Microsoft platform.

At a minimum, we're looking for:

  • At least twelve years of hands-on, professional experience with Microsoft data/analytics platforms
  • Knowledge of data warehouse concepts and dimensional modeling techniques
  • Experience developing reports or dashboards
  • Strong aptitude with T-SQL statements and DAX functions
  • Self-starter, quick learner, with a positive, collaborative, and team-based attitude
  • Excellent communication skills, with interests in presenting and blogging
  • Degree in information technology, computer science, business, or engineering
  • Ability to travel across the U.S., with an average of 25% travel to client locations per year
  • Ability to work from home when not on-site at client locations
  • Authorization to work in the U.S., without the requirement for an employment visa

In addition, these score you extra points:

  • Microsoft or other industry certifications for BI, DW, or analytics
  • Microsoft Azure, Power BI, or big data knowledge/experience
  • Interest in advanced analytics, machine learning, and languages including R and Python
  • Demonstration of thought leadership, community volunteering, recognition or awards
  • Master's degree in technology or business

Your primary responsibilities would include:

  • Lead discovery, planning, and architecture design of data and analytics solutions using Microsoft SQL, Power BI, and Azure platforms
  • Lead the development of informative and interactive data visualizations/models with SSRS or Power BI
  • Work hands-on with data and analytics components of SQL Server (such as SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, MDS/DQS, or ML Services)
  • Leverage Azure Data Services and Power BI to deliver cloud solutions
  • Write relational, tabular and multidimensional database queries, flows and movements
  • Obtain and maintain technical certifications in these core areas of expertise
  • Add value to each project through effective leadership and team collaboration

BlueGranite is the driving force of data innovation for our customers. We are trusted advisors who use our aptitude and experience to deliver value to our clients. We invest in our team to become better at who we are and what we do. Our core strategy is to lead with offers for data, insights, and analytics that deliver business value on the Microsoft platform.

This position is predominantly remote, work from home, with an average of 25% overnight travel per year. BlueGranite employees are located in Michigan, Illinois, Indiana, Ohio, Colorado, Texas, Minnesota, Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina, New York, New Hampshire, Florida, or Massachusetts only.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

items.title: Cloud Solutions Architect at Dito (Mountain View, CA)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=16, c=0, mobile=1, go=3, nodejs=3, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=12, apple=0, java=26, gamedev=0, php=23, embedded=0, frontend=30}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Lead
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, Information Technology, Technology Consulting
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Dito is looking for a Cloud Solutions Architect to join our team!   The position is remote so you will get to enjoy the luxuries and flexibility of working from home.  As a Cloud Solutions Architect, the key responsibility will be to drive enterprise infrastructure, applications and analytics to public clouds while supporting the Sales team to develop and earn new business with prospects and existing customers.  The position may be remote but our teams work together closely with you playing a crucial role in addressing “buying” questions that will involve the design and implementations of public and hybrid cloud application architecture, as well as cloud-hosted business intelligence.   You will get to leverage your creative juices and technical abilities around infrastructure, system and application design using web, mobile, cloud, and open source technologies. Experience across various enterprise solutions/ technology stacks (IaaS/PaaS/SaaS) and ability to provide guidance to diverse stakeholders and external vendors will be the foundation of yours and our success!   A few details about your day to day objectives; 

  • Lead change across large platforms / functional areas / organizations to public clouds.
  • Conduct architectural and engineering review of proposed IT investments/solutions to determine the strategic alignment and technical soundness.
  • Demonstrate thought leadership in cloud computing across multiple channels and become a trusted advisor to decision makers.
  • Identify, develop and document repeatable design and implementation methodology 
  • Partner with project teams, vendors, support organizations, functional architects, systems specialists and other technical resources in this hands-on role driving cloud migration/adoption from inception to production implementation.
  • Collaborate with the product, data, and infrastructure architects and be responsible for the defining-designing-delivering the technical architectures, patterns, technical quality, risks, fitness for purpose and operability of technical architecture solutions.
  • Provide technical recommendations to senior executives to assist the decisions on proposed IT investments/solutions and assume responsibility for technical presentations demonstrating a good understanding of application, data, infrastructure, architecture expertise and application systems design. 
  • Lead application workload and data migration, design and build interfaces between applications and other providers, as well as ownership of overall migration effort, workloads, backup and DR services  
  • Able to analyze, design, and implement cloud migration strategies without impacting business continuity 
  • Project scoping skills; methods, knowledge and experience of application processes, development, implementation and deployment to achieve project objectives. 

Skills: Languages: Python, Go, Ruby, Java, PHP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL

Frameworks: LAMP, J2EE, .NET, Ruby on Rails, Backbone JS, Angular JS, React, Wordpress

Cloud and Automation: Google Cloud (App Engine, Container Engine, Compute Engine, Kubernetes, Cloud Functions, BigQuery, Dataflow, Dataproc, Datalab, Dataprep, Pub/Sub, Data Studio, TensorFlow, Cloud Deployment Manager, Google Cloud Storage, Google Cloud SQL, Google Cloud Bigtable, and Google Cloud Datastore), Chef, Puppet, Docker, Kubernetes, HAProxy, , Amazon Web Services (EC2, S3, RDS, CloudFormation, IAM, Route 53, VPC, SNS, SES, SQS) Google Cloud Storage, Google Cloud SQL, Google Cloud Bigtable, and Google Cloud Datastore Big Data: Google BigQuery, Cloudera, Hive, AWS Redshift 
CI / CD / Build: Jenkins, Rundeck, CodeShip.io, Nexus

Monitoring and Logging: StackDriver, Syslog, Splunk, Nagios, New Relic, Cloudwatch

Version Control: Git, Subversion, SVN

OS: RedHat, CentOS, Ubuntu, Windows 2012 Servers

Application Servers: Tomcat, Nginx, Apache

About Dito

Since 2008 we've been helping organizations change the way they do business by leveraging cloud technologies, and more specifically Google Cloud enterprise solutions (Google Cloud Platform, G Suite Business, Chrome Enterprise, and Google Maps).

Benefits

Remote workforce

items.title: Solution Architect (U.S. residents only - Remote position) at StayWell

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Digital Health, Health & Fitness
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: Private

Job description

We are seeking a Solution Architect to play a critical role across our product lines as well as being a thought leader within the technology organization. This role includes definition, architecture and implementation of foundational solutions in support of StayWell product lines. You will be challenged to turn solutions around quickly but thoughtfully, balancing speed to delivery with security, quality, longevity and scalability.

The Solution Architect will also be integral in helping to cultivate an environment of innovation through architectural guidance, technology direction and evangelism of best practices to ensure the team is equipped to deliver industry leading solutions for our customers and patients.  Working within a diverse technology stack the Solution Architect will be instrumental in the modernization and optimization of highly impactful products which help people improve their health and wellness.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following (other duties may be assigned):

  • Design solutions that add value and efficiency across systems. Evaluate and undertake impact analyses on major design options and assess associated risks.
  • Define, maintain, and manage architecture models, frameworks and artifacts (e.g. current and future state application architecture diagrams, data models, etc.).
  • Collaborate closely with management in assessing business strategy and priorities, and tuning solutions to business goals.
  • Collaborate closely with technology system and team leads in determining optimal solutions to product goals, and aligning system/architecture roadmaps to product plans.
  • Support development of cross-functional business processes; identify alternative solutions, assess feasibility, and recommend new approaches via technology enablement. Evaluate the system factors which must be addressed in change management.
  • Develop and manage expectations for communication channels and/or stakeholder groups. Initiate communications between key contributors and stakeholders, acting as a single point of contact for cross-functional solution architecture. Facilitate open communication and discussion between stakeholders.
  • Stay informed on technology trends and product roadmaps to make strategic solution architecture recommendations.


Qualified candidates will have experience in the following:

  • Direct experience with product development in an enterprise setting, leveraging modern technology stacks and cloud-based systems such as AWS.
    • Significant experience with Node.js highly preferred
    • Experience React and React Native preferred
  • Strong knowledge of various integration approaches such as microservices, messaging, queuing, API patterns, etc.
  • Experience leading / managing an enterprise development work stream involving several systems, teams and user profiles.
  • Strong understanding of agile methodologies (Scaled Agile Framework preferred)
  • Ability to interact at all levels of the client organization
  • Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment


Education and/or Experience:
Bachelor's degree (B. S.) in Computer related subject area or related business field and eight (8) or more year’s experience in Information Technology and solution delivery, or equivalent combination of education and experience in similar fields is required. Experience working with SAAS based solution delivery organization (preferred).

About StayWell

At StayWell, we believe in the transformational power of health. Through the science of behavior change, education and inspiration, we have taken the guess work out of healthy living. And we do this by empowering people to take active roles in their own health – whether they’re patients, employees, or individuals just trying to stay well. We help inspire people to become healthier, happier employees at work. We help them have a more balanced and rewarding life at home. And we provide information that helps make patients smarter. In fact, everything we do maximizes the likelihood of the best possible outcomes. Which has a positive impact on families, businesses and communities. Because there is no mission more important than improving human health.

StayWell has a 40-year history of unparalleled expertise in improving health – whether at the point of care, in the workplace, or at home. But we know that every day the way people consume information is changing. We are continually working to integrate our proven, evidence-based solutions into forward-thinking, tech-driven delivery mechanisms, ensuring that we provide people with the right information, at the right time, and in the right way to maximize our impact on health outcomes. Our organization places great weight on technical innovation, and we’re looking for awesome tech talent to catalyze our momentum.

Our team is nearly 100% remote. We create several different product lines related to our health and wellness business and patient education content. Our history, our access to member and patient data, and the relationships we have established put us in a very unique position of truly being able to make a difference as it relates to improving our healthcare system.  

Benefits

Competitive Salary
Fitness Center and Fitness Reimbursement
Medical plans, dental and vision coverage
Work from home options
Health Savings Account, Flex Savings Account
401K Retirement Savings Plan
Tuition assistance, paid time for volunteerism
